metadata.title: CVE-2016-10268 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.description:
tools/tiffcp.c in LibTIFF 4.0.7 allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (integer underflow and heap-based buffer under-read) or possiblyhave unspecified other impact via a crafted TIFF image, related to "READ ofsize 78490" and libtiff/tif_unix.c:115:23.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10268` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.8').
